info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.
info.summary: Voucherify is an API-first promotion engine

force.name: force
force.description: If this flag is set to `true`, the voucher will be removed permanently. It means that afterwards, the user will be able to create the next voucher with the same code.

audienceRulesOnly.name: audienceRulesOnly
audienceRulesOnly.description: This parameter set to true will ask only for verifying vouchers' validation rules only against conditions applied to audiences' attributes (belonging into segment and metadata)

order.name: order
order.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` means sorting in a descending order.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100 items.

campaignId.name: campaignId
campaignId.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the campaign.

page.name: page
page.description: Which page of results to return

category.name: category
category.description: Limit search results to vouchers within the specified category

campaign_id.name: campaign_id
campaign_id.description: Limit search results to vouchers within the specified campaign

customer.name: customer
customer.description: A tracking identifier of a customer who is the holder of the vouchers. It can be an `id` generated by Voucherify or the `source_id`. Remember to use the proper URL escape codes if the `source_id` contains special characters.

campaign.name: campaign
campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the parent campaign.

created_at.name: created_at

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

created_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `created_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[created_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

created_at[before].name: created_at[before]
created_at[before].description: Return values where the resource's `created_at` field is before this date. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`).

created_at[after].name: created_at[after]
created_at[after].description: Return values where the resource's `created_at` field is after this date. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`).

updated_at.name: updated_at

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was updated in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `updated_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[updated_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

updated_at[after].name: updated_at[after]
updated_at[after].description: Return values where the resource's `updated_at` field is after this date. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`).

updated_at[before].name: updated_at[before]
updated_at[before].description: Return values where the resource's `updated_at` field is before this date. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`).

1_obj_voucher_object.title: VoucherObject
1_obj_voucher_object.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description:
Object representing discount parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`
- `UNIT`
- `FIXED`

 A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

assets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

validation_rules_assignments.description: Stores information about validation rules assigned to the voucher.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: Array of validation rule objects. Each validation rule object contains details about the rule.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule assignment.

rule_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule.

related_object_id.description: Id of the object from which the rule originates, can be the id of the `voucher` itself or its parent `campaign`.

related_object_type.description: Which object does the rule originate from: the  `voucher` itself or inherited from its parent `campaign`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `validation_rules_assignment`

total.description: Total number of validation rules assigned to the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

redeemed_amount.description: Total Amount redeemed by the voucher. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 balance is written as 10000.

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or publish voucher API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

1_req_vouchers__POST.title: req_vouchers__POST
1_req_vouchers__POST.description: Request body schema for creating a voucher.

examples.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters. Pass this attribute in the request body if you want to deliberately create a distinct code. Otherwise, use the `code_config` object to design rules that the Voucherify API should use to create a random code.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign. **Required** for `LOYALTY_CARD` type.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description:
Defines discount voucher; **required** when`type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`
- `UNIT`
- `FIXED`

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

gift.description: Defines gift card; **required** when type parameter is `GIFT_VOUCHER`.

amount.description: Total gift card income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is active. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the id of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

code_config.description: Defines code's pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc). Pass this attribute in the request body if you want to design rules that the Voucherify API should use to create a random code. Otherwise, use the `code` object to define a distinct code.

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

1_req_vouchers_code_POST.title: req_vouchers_code_POST
1_req_vouchers_code_POST.description: Request body schema for creating a voucher.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of voucher.

discount.description:
Defines discount voucher; **required** when`type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:
- `AMOUNT`
- `PERCENT`

- `FIXED`

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

amount.description: Total voucher income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is active. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the id of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `list`.

vouchers.description: A dictionary that contains an array of  vouchers. Each entry in the array is a separate voucher object.

total.description: Returns how many vouchers in the project meet the limits defined by the query parameter definitions.

1_req_vouchers_code_PUT.title: req_vouchers_code_PUT
1_req_vouchers_code_PUT.description: Request body schema for updating a voucher.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

discount.description:
Defines discount voucher; **required** when`type` is `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`. Type of discount:

A Free Shipping discount is a special instance of the  `UNIT` type discount.

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Total points incurred over lifespan of loyalty card.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

obj_earning_rule_object.description: This is an object representing an earning rule.
obj_earning_rule_object.title: EarningRuleObject

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the earning rule object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

points.description: The number of points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card. `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`.
Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio

order.description: Defines proportion for calculating how many points to add to a loyalty card. The ratio is based on the order amount. For `every` dollar spent, the customer will get this many `points`.

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the order amount.

every.description: Order amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

custom_event.description: Contains the schema id of a custom event. **Required** for the custom event option in `event`.

schema_id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a custom event schema. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

segment.description: Contains the id of a customer segment. **Required** for the `customer.segment.entered` option in `event`.

id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a customer segment. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `order.paid` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to an order status `PAID`. Read more here.  
- `customer.segment.entered` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer entering a pre-defined customer segment. Read more here.  
- `custom_event_name` the name of a custom event defined in the Dashboard → **Project Settings** → **EVENT SCHEMA** → **Add event definition**. Read more on defining custom events.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `earning_rule`.

codes.description: A string array of voucher codes.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

req_loyalties_campaignId_earning-rules.description: This data model represents the request body for the `/loyalties/{campaignId}/earning-rules` endpoint.
req_loyalties_campaignId_earning-rules.title: RequestBodyLoyaltiesCampaignIDEarningRules

event.description:
Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.  

- `order.paid` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to an order status `PAID`. Read more here.  
- `customer.segment.entered` an event defined by the Voucherify API corresponding to a customer entering a pre-defined customer segment. Read more here.  
- `custom_event_name` the name of a custom event defined in the Dashboard → **Project Settings** → **EVENT SCHEMA** → **Add event definition**. Read more on defining custom events.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

loyalty.description:
An object that defines the number of points that will be added to a loyalty card and how the points will be added.

- `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`
- `PROPORTIONAL` adds points proportionally based on a pre-defined ratio

points.description: The number of points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card. `FIXED` adds a fixed number of `points`.
Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card.`PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio

order.description: Defines proportion for calculating how many points to add to a loyalty card. The ratio is based on the order amount. For `every` dollar spent, the customer will get this many `points`.

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the order amount.

every.description: Order amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` of the campaign or the earning rule's own `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* earning rule
- `false` indicates an *inactive* earning rule

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Earning rule is *inactive before* this date. If you don't define the start date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Earning rule is *inactive after* this date.If you don't define the expiration date for an earning rule, it'll inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day. `start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

custom_event.description: Contains the schema id of a custom event. **Required** for the custom event option in `event`.

schema_id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a custom event schema. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

segment.description: Contains the id of a customer segment. **Required** for the `customer.segment.entered` option in `event`.

id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a customer segment. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

async_action_id.description: The id of the scheduled async action. It informs that your request has been accepted and metadata will be added to the repository asynchronously. To check the import status and result, copy async action id from the response and pass it using this endpoint[hyperlink-endpoint].

type.description: Applies an amount discount

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order

type.description: Applies a percentage discount

percent_off.description: Percent taken off the subtotal amount

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order

type.description: Sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply

fixed_amount.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description:
- **APPLY\_TO\_ORDER**: Set fixed total on the whole cart. Discount will be calculated dynamically, based on fixed amount value. For example, if fixed amount is set to equal $10 and order amount equals $25, then the calculated discount will be $15.  
- **APPLY\_TO\_ITEMS**: This type of deal applies a new price for line items. 
  Default rules:
   - During redemption, prices will change only if the new one is lower than the old one.
    - If a product price in the collection and the new product price you have set up differs, then the new product price will be passed during the redemption.
    - When a product is in two collections, we always change the price to the lowest.
    - The new price for products with several SKUs will force the price change for SKUs if their price is higher than the new price.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s)

unit_off.description: Number of units to subtract from the subtotal

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product  inventory (e.g. time, items)

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s)

effect.description: Defines the effect for adding multiple item types.

units.description: Array of objects defining items to be offered for free. Each item type can have a different discount effect assigned.

unit_off.description: Number of units to subtract from the subtotal

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product  inventory (e.g. time, items)

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s)

unit_off.description: Subtracts 1 shipping item from the subtotal

unit_type.description: The shipping product deemed as free

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order

amount.description: The incremental amout to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.
The incremental amout added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: The balance after adding an additional amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: The type of voucher being modified.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `balance`.

related_object.description: Defines the object that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

type.description: The object being modified.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified, this is the id that was assigned by the Voucherify API.

1_obj_vouchers_import_gift_voucher.title: Import Gift Voucher
1_obj_vouchers_import_gift_voucher.description: Object model for gift voucher object being imported.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

type.description: Represents the voucher type.

amount.description: Total gift card income. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

1_obj_vouchers_import_discount_voucher.title: Import Discount Voucher
1_obj_vouchers_import_discount_voucher.description: Object model for discount voucher object being imported.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

type.description: Represents the voucher type.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

async_action_id.description: The id of the scheduled async action. It informs that your request has been accepted and voucher(s) will be added to the repository asynchronously. To check the import status and result, copy async action id from the response and pass it using this endpoint[hyperlink-endpoint].

file.description: The property name 'file' will be used for the file path.

object.description: The type of object represented by JSON. Default is `list`.

total.description: Total valid and active vouchers matching the qualification criteria in given context.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the qualification was created in ISO 8601 format.

1_req_vouchers_bulk_async.title: RequestBodyVouchersBulkAsync
1_req_vouchers_bulk_async.description: Array of objects each containing the code to be updated and the metadata object containing the key/value pairs to be updated.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

async_action_id.description: The id of the scheduled async action. It informs that your request has been accepted and voucher(s) will be updated in the repository asynchronously. To check the update status and result, copy async action id from the response and pass it using this endpoint[hyperlink-endpoint].

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. You can provide your own (e.g. CRM id) or use the one returned by Voucherify, see tracking_id from Validate Voucher (client-side). A tracking identifier of a user that validate a voucher. It is build based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned in origin voucher validation method done by specific customer, or a string identifying customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object. It is displayed alongside a customer in the dashboard.

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes address.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object for segment building.

id.description: The ID of an existing order that will be linked to redemption in this request.

source_id.description: The merchants order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order items (sum of item.amount)

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

discount_amount.description:
Summarize all discounts applied to the order inlcuding discounts applied to particular order line items and discounts applied to the whole cart.

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by product_id or sku_id. Along with every item you must define quantity.A list of Order Items that have been applied to the order. hyperlink the Order Items to another object.

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order item (price * quantity).

You should provide it to retrieve `discount_amount` if the discount is applied only to this item.

discount_amount.description:
Represents total amount of the discount applied to order line items

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 is written as 10000.

product.description: An object containing details of related product. Those details will be used for validation and redemption processes on top of details already stored in system.

override.description: The `override` is used once the product should be stored in system. If product does not exists it will be created with the use of `source_id`.

sku.description: An object containing details of related SKU. Those details will be used for validation and redemption processes on top of details already stored in system.

override.description: The override is used once the product should be stored in system. If sku does not exists it will be created with the use of `source_id`. If sku does not exists it's required to set `product_id` that it belongs to.

customer.description: The customer used for the order.

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: Metadata can be a string, number, boolean, date, datetime, image_url, object, geopoint, unknown. | related objects: campaign, voucher, publication, redemption, product, customer, order, order_item, loyalty_tier, promotion_tier.

key.description: Unique session identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description:
The type of session. Required to establish a new session. 

`LOCK`: Locks the following parameters within the session:

- redemption quantity by 1
- redemption gift credits specified with the requests
- redemption loyalty points specified with the request

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by `session.ttl_unit`.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

req_vouchers_metadata_1_test.description: Request body to update metadata in bulk *asynchronously*.

req_vouchers_metadata_2_test.description: Request body to update metadata in bulk *asynchronously*.

tags.name: VOUCHERS API
tags.description: Manage discount and gift card vouchers.

tags.name: CAMPAIGNS API
tags.description: Group vouchers or promotion tiers of a specific type.

tags.name: STACKABLE DISCOUNTS API
tags.description: Manage multiple discounts in one request.

tags.name: ASYNC ACTIONS API
tags.description: Track asynchronous operations scheduled in Projects.

get.description: Retrieves the voucher with the given `code`.

200.description:
Returns a voucher object if a valid identifier was provided. 

Additionally, the response returns validation rules related to the voucher object. They can be inherited from a campaign.

404.description: Not Found. When requesting the code of a voucher that has been deleted, the resource will not be returned.

put.description:
Updates the specified voucher by setting the values of the parameters passed in the request body. Any parameters not provided in the payload will be left unchanged.

You can modify the following fields:  

- `category`
- `start_date`
- `expiration_date`
- `active`
- `additional_info`
- `metadata`
- `validity_day_of_week`
- `validity_timeframe`
- `gift` → `amount` + `effect`
- `loyalty_card` → `points`
- `discount` ↓
  - Amount type → `amount_off` + `effect` + **requires** `type`=`AMOUNT` 
  - Percent type → `percent_off` + `effect`
  - Fixed type → `fixed_amount` + `effect` + **requires** `type`=`FIXED` 
  - Unit type ↓ 
    - One item → `unit_off` + `unit_type` + `effect` + **requires** `type`=`UNIT`
    - Multiple item types → `unit_off` + `unit_type` + `effect` + **requires** higher level `type`=`UNIT` & `effect`=`ADD_MANY_ITEMS` (HERE ONLY TYPE=UNIT IS REQUIRED - IF I DON'T PASS THE OTHER ATTRIBUTES, IT DELETES THEM FROM THE VOUCHER OBJECT RESPONSE)
  - ~~Shipping type → `unit_off` + `unit_type` + `effect` + **requires** `type`=`UNIT`~~ 

Fields other than the ones listed above won't be modified. Even if provided, they will be silently skipped.

value.additional_info: This voucher is being activated.
This gift card is disabled.
This loyalty card is being deactivated and points updated.

requestBody.description: Specify the parameters to be updated.

200.description: Returns the voucher object if the update succeeded. Returns an error if update parameters are invalid (e.g. specifying an invalid gift amount).

value.additional_info: This voucher is being activated.
This gift card is disabled.
This loyalty card is being deactivated and points updated.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.

delete.description: Deletes a voucher. This operation cannot be undone. Additionally, this operation immediately removes any redemptions on the voucher.

post.description:
Create a standalone voucher. You can choose to create a `GIFT_VOUCHER`, a `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`, or a `LOYALTY_CARD`. The code path parameter can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.  

When you create a new voucher, you can specify a type to create it.
Creating a new voucher will create a new stand alone voucher if no `campaign` name or `campaign_id` is provided. In case of the loyalty card, a campaign name is required.

This method will return an error when trying to create a voucher that already exists.

value.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This gift card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This loyalty card is enabled immediately upon creation.

requestBody.description: Specify the details of the voucher that you would like to create.

200.description: Returns a voucher object if the call succeeded.

value.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This gift card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This loyalty card is enabled immediately upon creation.

200.description: Returns a voucher object if the call succeeded.

value.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This gift card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This loyalty card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.

post.description:
Create a standalone voucher. You can choose to create a `GIFT_VOUCHER`, a `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`, or a `LOYALTY_CARD`. 

When you create a new voucher, you can specify a type to create it.
Creating a new voucher will create a new stand alone voucher if no `campaign` name or `campaign_id` is provided. In case of the loyalty card, a campaign name is required.

You can optionally use the `code` parameter to define a specific code or the `code_config` parameter to design rules for Voucherify API to create a random code. If neither of the two parameters are passed, then a random code is generated by the Voucherify API.

This method will return an error when trying to create a voucher that already exists.

value.additional_info: This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This gift card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This loyalty card is enabled immediately upon creation.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.
This voucher will remain inactive until enabled.

requestBody.description: Specify the details of the voucher that you would like to create.

get.description:
Returns a list of your vouchers. The vouchers are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent vouchers appearing first.

When you get a list of vouchers, you can optionally specify query parameters to customize the amount of vouchers returned per call using `limit`, which page of vouchers to return using `page`, sort the vouchers using the `order` query parameter and more.

This method will return an error when trying to return a limit of more than 100 vouchers.

200.description: Returns a dictionary that contains an array of vouchers. Each entry in the array is a separate voucher object. If no more vouchers are available (query parameter `page` incremented over and above the voucher count), the resulting array will be empty. The result can be narrowed down according to specified (or default) filters.

post.description:
There are various times when you'll want to manage a voucher's accessibility. This can be done by two API methods for managing the voucher state - *enable* and *disable*.  
___
Sets voucher state to **active**. The voucher can be redeemed - only if the redemption occurs after the start date and the voucher is not expired.

404.description: Not Found. If the voucher code does not exist, this call returns an error.

value.details: Cannot find voucher with id IrKORhS

post.description:
There are various times when you'll want to manage a voucher's accessibility. This can be done by two API methods for managing the voucher state - *enable* and *disable*.  
___
Sets voucher state to **inactive**. The voucher cannot be redeemed.

404.description: Not Found. If the voucher code does not exist, this call returns an error.

post.description: Add balance to an existing gift card.

post.description:
Import standalone vouchers and gift cards into the repository.

<!-- theme: info -->

> #### Important notes
>
> - Start and expiration dates need to be provided in compliance with the ISO 8601 norms. For example, 2020-03-11T09:00:00.000Z.
> - Custom code attributes (not supported by-default) need to be added as code metadata.
> - You cannot import the same codes to a single Voucherify Project.

Any parameters not provided in the payload will be left blank or null.

For both standalone discount vouchers and gift cards, you can import the following fields:  

- `code`
- `category`
- `active`
- `type`
- `start_date`
- `expiration_date`
- `redemption` → `quantity`
- `additional_info`
- `metadata`

For gift cards, you can import the following field:

- `gift` → `amount`

For discount vouchers, you can import the `discount` field; the object will slightly vary depending on the type of discount. Each discount type **requires** the `type` to be defined in the import.

- `discount` ↓
  - Amount type → `amount_off`, `effect`
  - Percent type → `percent_off`, `effect`
  - Fixed type → `fixed_amount`, `effect`
  - Unit type ↓ 
    - One item → `unit_off`, `unit_type`, `effect`
    - Multiple item types → `unit_off`, `unit_type`, `effect`
  - Shipping type → `unit_off`, `unit_type`, `effect`

Fields other than the ones listed above won't be imported. Even if provided, they will be silently skipped.

requestBody.description: The request body is an array of objects. Each object contains details about a specific voucher.

202.description: Returns id of scheduled async action. The response informs you that your request has been accepted and vouchers will be added to the repository asynchronously. To check the import status and result, copy the `async_action_id` from the response and pass it using the Get Async Action endpoint.[hyperlink to Get async action endpoint].

post.description:
Import standalone vouchers into the repository using a CSV file.

The CSV file has to include headers in the first line. All properties listed in the file headers that cannot be mapped to standard voucher fields will be added to the metadata object.

You can find an example CSV file [here](https://support.voucherify.io/article/45-import-codes-and-share-them-digitally#coupons).
___
Curl Example
```
curl -X POST \
  https://api.voucherify.io/v1/vouchers/importCSV \
  -F file=@/path/to/vouchers.csv \
  -H "X-App-Id: c70a6f00-cf91-4756-9df5-47628850002b" \
  -H "X-App-Token: 3266b9f8-e246-4f79-bdf0-833929b1380c"
```

<!-- theme: info -->

> #### Standard voucher fields mapping
>
> Go to the [import vouchers](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1vouchers~1import) to see all standard CSV fields description(section body params).
> - Supported CSV file headers: Code,Voucher Type,Value,Discount Type,Category,Start Date,Expiration Date,Redemption Limit,Active,Additional Info,Spotlight
>- Start and expiration dates need to be provided in compliance with the ISO 8601 norms. For example, 2020-03-11T09:00:00.000Z.
> - Custom code attributes (not supported by-default) need to be added as code metadata.
> - You cannot import the same codes to a single Voucherify Project.

<!-- theme: info -->

> #### Standard voucher fields mapping
>
> In the structure representing your data, you can define a category that the voucher belongs to. You can later use the category of a voucher to group and search by specific criteria.

requestBody.description: The file path is stored in the form `file` header.

200.description: Returns id of scheduled async action. The response informs you that your request has been accepted and vouchers will be added to the repository asynchronously. To check the import status and result, copy the `async_action_id` from the response and pass it using the Get Async Action endpoint.[hyperlink to Get async action endpoint].

post.description:
Display vouchers qualified to the given customer and context (e.g., order, loyalty reward). Checks up to 50 standalone vouchers.
___

As a sample use case, you can imagine a requirement of displaying coupons available for the customer below the shopping cart. The customer can choose and apply the proposed voucher.

The verification logic won't run against coupons from bulk unique code campaigns. For campaigns with multiple unique codes, you should run a [dedicated function]"hyperlink when create this endpoint in openapi create-qualification-request" for searching and identifying qualified campaigns.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of vouchers to be qualified.

requestBody.description: Should contain given customer and context such as order or reward.

200.description: This operation returns the list of valid and active vouchers based on the qualification of given context (e.g., customer profile, redemptions metadata, order).

post.description:
Update up to **100 records** in one request.
Upserts are not supported.  

**NOTE:** Currently only **metadata** updates are supported.

requestBody.description: List codes to be updated and metadata key/value pairs.

delete.description: Manually release a validation session that has been set up for the voucher.

post.description: Create earning rules for a loyalty campaign.

200.description: Returns an array of earning rule objects.

source.banner: Order Paid - You will get 100 points

requestBody.description:
Customize the request body based on the type of earning rules you would like to create. The request body is an array of objects. The required minimum properties to include in the payload for each object are `event` and `loyalty`. Additionally, if you choose to add a `validity_timeframe`, you must include a `start_date`. Furthermore, an earning rule `event` type:  

- `customer.segment.entered` requires a `segment` object
- a custom event requires a `custom_event` object
